questions.label: How many people live with the patient
Total number of beneficiaries in family consultation

sections.label: Main problem or reason for referral

questions.label: Main problem or reason for referral
questions.questionInfo: Why is the patient coming to the MH department? Write in patientâ€™s words

sections.label: Current symptoms or complaints (What is the patient reporting / what are you seeing?)
Select the main problems prioritized as 1, 2 and 3 from the lists

hide.hideWhenExpression: isEmpty(psychosomatic) && isEmpty(depressionRelated) && isEmpty(anxietyRelated) && isEmpty(traumaRelated) && isEmpty(psychosisRelated) && isEmpty(neurocognitiveProblems) && isEmpty(behaviorProblems) && isEmpty(otherSymptoms)

questions.label: Current symptoms or complaints 1
questions.questionInfo: If current suicidal thoughts, recent suicide attempt, or current psychotic symptoms consider referral to psychologist - mhGAP clinician.

questions.label: Current symptoms or complaints 2
questions.questionInfo: If current suicidal thoughts, recent suicide attempt, or current psychotic symptoms consider referral to psychologist /  mhGAP clinician.

questions.label: Current symptoms or complaints 3
questions.questionInfo: If current suicidal thoughts, recent suicide attempt, or current psychotic symptoms consider referral to psychologist /  mhGAP clinician.

questions.label: Important details of the main problem. How long have they had the problem? (significant events etc.)
Patient presentation
questions.questionInfo: How do they look or speak / motor activity / mood / thoughts / perceptions? Is the patient oriented in time / space / person / recent events?

questions.label: Clinical diagnosis (only to be established by a psychologist)
Did you have problems performing daily activities such as cooking bathing or chores outside the household?
Did you have problems getting along with family or friends?
Did you have any problems sleeping such as sleeping too much or not enough?
Have you been bothered by unpleasant thoughts worries or ideas?
Have you felt sad or nervous?
In general in the past week how well has the child been feeling?
Did the child have problems playing doing chores homework or other day to day activities
Did the child have problems getting along with others
Did the child have problems paying attention understanding or remembering things
Did the child have problems with his appetite such as having too little or too much hunger
Did the child have problem sleeping such as sleeping too much or not enough
Did the child complain about pain or discomfort with his/her body
Did the child seek comfort and closeness from someone
Did the child wet the bed
Was the child sad or irritable
Was the child worried or scared
In general how helpful were the therapeutic or counselling sessions FOR YOUR CHILD
In general how helpful were the therapeutic or counselling sessions FOR YOU
MHOS score

questions.questionInfo: Sum of all points from answers above

sections.label: PHQ-9 (only for depression) - Over the last two weeks, how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems?

questions.label: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Trouble falling or staying asleep or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Feeling bad about yourself - or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
Trouble concentrating on things such as reading the newspaper or watching television
Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed Or the opposite - being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
PHQ-9 score

questions.questionInfo: Sum of all points from answers above

questions.label: If you checked off any problems, how difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people
Depression severity scale
questions.questionInfo: A patient is considered as having signs of depression if: The answer to at least one of the first two questions is â€œmore than half the timeâ€ AND the question about difficulty at home, work and going along with others is answered at least â€œsomewhat difficultâ€. Consider referral to mhGAP clinician/ psychiatrist if major/severe depression.

questions.label: CGI-S score - How mentally ill is the patient at this time
questions.questionInfo: If the patientâ€™s  score â‰¥ 5, consider referral to mhGAP clinician / psychiatrist.

questions.label: Positive functionality Is the patient capable of being independent caring for themselves (bathing/eating) going to work/school etc.
Internal resources Does the patient believe that they have the abilities needed to overcome the current problem / do they have hope for their future
External resources Does the patient believe that they have someone who they can rely on for help in their lives
Spiritual / moral resources Are the patients beliefs a source of strength for them when dealing with problems

sections.label: Risk factors (in the last 6 months, except for the last question)

questions.label: Has the patient had thoughts of death or suicide
Has the patient hurt themselves / caused self-harm
Has the patient attempted suicide or tried to kill themselves
Is the patient currently at risk of hurting himself/herself or attempting suicide
Action taken to reduce risk of hurting himself/herself
Is the patient currently at risk of hurting others
Action taken to reduce risk of hurting others
Does the patient regularly use alcohol / substances to become intoxicated
Is the patient currently on psychotropic / psychiatric medication
Has the patient experienced an act of aggression or violence
Time between violence event and consultation
Would the patient like a referral to the medical department for treatment (or midwife/maternity for sexual violence)?

sections.label: Past / precipitating events (possible reasons or causes linked to current problem)
Select the main events prioritized as 1, 2 and 3 from the lists

questions.label: Relevant details of the past / precipitating events
Overall goals for therapy
questions.questionInfo: What are you trying to accomplish over several sessions with the patient? Try to be specific & define these with the patient.

questions.label: Todays Session (what did you do today in session)
Homework (what will the patient do before next session)
Follow up session required (If no fill the Exit form)
